bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Earl and Sylvia Price were members of the Communist Party USA in New York City who were expelled in the late 1940s because they held that the CPUSA, although it had expelled its "revisionist" leader Earl Browder in 1945, had not thereafter become sufficiently radical and militant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection contains materials created by various groupings of former members of the Communist Party USA who were expelled for their excessive radicalism in the years following World War II.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Earl and Sylvia Price are held by Earl and Sylvia Price. Permission to publish or reproduce materaisl to which they hold copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Earl and Sylvia Price.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials found in repository, provenance is unknown but were likely donated by Earl and Sylvia Price in 1994. The accession number associated with this gift is 1994.006.
